column4: hey peeps..are there any 'slice' apps for linux..ie: like image ready for PS or fireworks ????
py-slice in gimp isn't working for me so :((....
what's a 'slice' app?
well it takes a image and slices it up into table format ..
page layout with tables for images?
you must be shitting me!
who on earth does serious webdesign with tables? ... yea i know there are a lot.
well some designs flat can not be done with just CSS
unless I'm not using css right...shrug..i'm a bit rusty so...
I just need to set my javascript code for mouseovers is all i'm really after but for that I must slice up this large image..can that be done with css ?
mouseovers? you man an ImageMap?
no ..I thought about using imagemap but not sure thats the way I want to go
so you want to split up an image into 100 of pieces. buy that adding lots of server load and stuff?
is that the standard way of doing things ?
ha not 100's..maybe 20 or so....anyway so I can do this with css ???
if you have 1 image . You open ONE stream. and get ONE header sent. if you slice it into 100 images you get 99 more open streams and 99 more headers
slicing - no, position, yes.
but for those questions I'd rather you to go to #web
well..its slightly more complicated than that
sounds good
thx
I stumped all 150 users so far LOL
so  I guesss ill be using a imagemap possibly LOL
